definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The labor song is the oldest ballad directly originating from physical labor.
sentences.chinese: 勞動歌是由體力勞動直接激發起來的最古老的歌謠。

sentences.english: He decided to overcome his physical weaknesses through exercise and hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他決定通過鍛鍊和重體力勞動來克服體質的病弱。

sentences.english: Furthermore, some people are not clear about the differences between physical labor and sports training.
sentences.chinese: 部分羣衆對體力勞動和體育鍛煉這兩者混淆不清。

sentences.english: Working with one's head causes a sensation of hunger quite as much as muscular work.
sentences.chinese: 腦力勞動與體力勞動引起的飢餓感覺是完全一樣的。
對你來說體力勞動最具教化力。

sentences.english: 11-12 Our mental make-up is suited to a life of very severe physical labour.
sentences.chinese: 我們的心理構成適合於重體力勞動的生活方式。

sentences.english: Our mental make-up is suited to a life of very severe physical labour.
sentences.chinese: 我們的心理構成適於乾重體力勞動的生活方式。

sentences.english: All we ever got was manual labour and illness.
sentences.chinese: 我們曾經得到的只有體力勞動和疾病。

sentences.english: If assisting some physical work, the epinephrine will excrete out with thje sweat.
sentences.chinese: 如果輔助體力勞動，腎上腺素會同汗水一起排出。

sentences.english: They were wearied out with the strenuous manual labour.
sentences.chinese: 他們被繁重的體力勞動搞得精疲力竭。

sentences.english: The attitude toward manual labor is seen in many aspects of America life.
sentences.chinese: 對待體力勞動的態度反映在美國生活的許多方面。

sentences.english: Or it could be something less physically demanding, such as needlepoint or crochet.
sentences.chinese: 或者可以少一些體力勞動，如針尖或蚤。

sentences.english: The computer release people frome hard manual work.
sentences.chinese: 計算機將人們從繁重的體力勞動中解脫出來。

definition: to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
responsible for its profit and losses (of organization)/financially autonomous/personal financial responsibility
lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4
